qas.question: What does the Himachal legislature consist of?

answers.text: elected members and special office bearers such as the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker who are elected by the members
the Speaker or the Deputy Speaker in the Speaker's absence

qas.question: Who is the Judiciary system made up of?

answers.text: Himachal Pradesh High Court and a system of lower courts.

qas.question: Who is the head of state appointed by the President of India?
How long are the terms of office?

answers.text: 5 years, unless the Assembly is dissolved prior to the completion of the term

qas.question: How many members are there in the Council of Ministers?
For how many years does a judiciary member serve?
Who is the head of state appointed by the lower courts?

plausible_answers.text: The leader of the party or coalition with a majority in the Legislative Assembly

qas.question: Who is appointed as the Chief Minister by the President of India?
Who are appointed by the MLA with advice from the President of India?

context: Himachal Pradesh is governed through a parliamentary system of representative democracy, a feature the state shares with other Indian states. Universal suffrage is granted to residents. The legislature consists of <a0_0>elected members and special office bearers such as the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker who are elected by the members<a0_0/>. Assembly meetings are presided over by <a1_0>the Speaker or the Deputy Speaker in the Speaker's absence<a1_0/>. The judiciary is composed of the <a2_0>Himachal Pradesh High Court and a system of lower courts.<a2_0/> Executive authority is vested in the Council of Ministers headed by the Chief Minister, although the titular head of government is the Governor. <a3_0><b7_0>The Governor<b7_0/><a3_0/> is the head of state appointed by the President of India. <b8_0>The leader of the party or coalition with a majority in the Legislative Assembly<b8_0/> is appointed as the Chief Minister by the Governor, and <b9_0>the Council of Ministers<b9_0/> are appointed by the Governor on the advice of the Chief Minister. The Council of Ministers reports to the Legislative Assembly. The Assembly is unicameral with <b5_0>68<b5_0/> Members of the Legislative Assembly (MLA). Terms of office run for <a4_0><b6_0>5 years<b6_0/>, unless the Assembly is dissolved prior to the completion of the term<a4_0/>. Auxiliary authorities known as panchayats, for which local body elections are regularly held, govern local affairs.
